sentences.en: A movement caught his eye in the tangled undergrowth.
sentences.cn: 乱灌木丛里的晃动引起了他的注意.

sentences.en: He had hair like tangled string.
sentences.cn: 他的头发就像一团乱麻。

sentences.en: Her hair had loosened and was tangled around her shoulders.
sentences.cn: 她的头发打了开来，散乱地披在肩上。

sentences.en: His personal life has become more tangled than ever.
sentences.cn: 他的个人生活比以前更混乱了。

sentences.en: Lee and I fell in a tangled heap.
sentences.cn: 李和我扭作一团，摔倒在地。

sentences.en: Life is a messy and tangled business.
sentences.cn: 生活就是一件既混乱又复杂的事情。

sentences.en: My legs got hopelessly tangled in the rope.
sentences.cn: 我的双腿完全被绳子缠住了.

sentences.en: Relationships are often a tangled web at the best of times.
sentences.cn: 即使在最好的情况下，关系也是错综复杂的。

sentences.en: She was tangled in a snarl of logs and branches.
sentences.cn: 她被困在一堆乱七八糟的木料和树枝中间。

sentences.en: the tangled web of local politics
sentences.cn: 地方政坛错综复杂的关系网

sentences.en: The themes get tangled in Mr. Mahfouz's epic storytelling.
sentences.cn: 马赫福兹先生讲述的故事过于宏大，主题有些混乱了。

sentences.en: The two threads got tangled up.
The wires are all tangled up.
The wrong shampoo can leave curly hair in a tangled mess.
sentences.cn: 不合适的洗发水会使卷发纠结成乱糟糟的一团。

sentences.en: Your bedclothes are all tangled up.
Your hair looks a bit tangled.
sentences.cn: 你的头发看起来有点乱.

sentences.en: Your hair's so tangled that I can't comb it.
sentences.cn: 你的头发太乱了,我梳不动.

words.tran_cn: 紊乱的；纠缠的；缠结的；复杂的

phrases.tran_cn: 与…吵架，争吵；与…争论；与…有纠葛

trans.tran_cn: 纠缠的，紊乱的，混乱的，杂乱的
trans.tran_en: twisted together in an untidy mass

trans.tran_cn: （使）缠结， （使）乱作一团( tangle的过去式和过去分词 )
